    <section id="main_content" class="inner">
    <h3>
        <a id="welcome-to-github-pages" class="anchor" href="#welcome-to-github-pages" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>Welcome to Ruby (Design) Patterns.</h3>

    <p>This project began as a way for me to teach some coworkers Ruby, but evolved into a class on Design Patterns, their implementations, and Test Driven Development.
       All of the code is rdoc complete and each pattern has a full set of rspec tests. To copy the source:</p>

    <pre>$ git clone https://github.com/Alistanis/DesignPatterns.git </pre>

        <h3>
        <a id="pattern-definitions" class="anchor" href="#pattern-definitions" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>Pattern Definitions
    </h3>
    <p>
        <a id="command" class="anchor" href="#command" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>
        <strong>Command Pattern </strong> - <span style="text-decoration: underline">declares an interface for executing an operation.</span>
        <br/> A behavioral design pattern in which an object is used to represent and encapsulate all the information needed to call a method at a later time.
        This information includes the method name, the object that owns the method and values for the method parameters.
    </p>
    <p>
        <a id="observer" class="anchor" href="#observer" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>
        <strong>Observer Pattern</strong> - <span style="text-decoration: underline">defines and maintains a dependency between objects.</span>
        <br/> The observer pattern is a software design pattern in which an object, called the subject, maintains a list of its dependents, called observers, and notifies them automatically of any state changes, usually by calling one of their methods.
        It is mainly used to implement distributed event handling systems. The Observer pattern is also a key part in the familiar model–view–controller (MVC) architectural pattern.
    </p>

    <h3>
        <a id="status" class="anchor" href="#status" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>Status<span style="font-size: 14px; font-weight: normal;"> - click on a pattern for its api docs</span>
    </h3>

    <p>
    <table>
        <tr><th>Pattern</th><th>Implemented</th><th>RDoc</th><th>Rspec</th></tr>
        <tr><td><a href="doc/Patterns/Command.html" aria-hidden="true">Command</a></td><td>Yes</td><td>Yes</td><td>Yes</td></tr>
        <tr><td><a href="doc/Patterns/Observer.html" aria-hidden="true">Observer</a><td>Yes</td><td>Yes</td><td>Yes</td></tr>
    </table>

    </p>

    <h3>
